title: Andersonville National Historic Site: Living History
body: Living History Volunteers         Living history volunteers pose as Union Prisoners of War NPS/Andersonville National Historic Site  Living History volunteers assist with programs that help visitors to better understand the prisoner of war experience at Camp Sumter during the Civil War. While living history can be done throughout the year, the park hosts two programs with a strong living history component.  To find out how you can help, please contact park staff at 229-924-0343 or through e-mail. Annual Living History Programs:  Living History Weekend (the second weekend in March annually)  Night Museum (January and November annually)  Resources:  Living History Program Handbook (Mandatory for all participants)  2016 Living History Events and Registration Deadlines  Living History Weekend: March 12-13, 2016 Registration Deadline: March 4, 2016 Registration form | Event Overview    Night Museum: November 12, 2016 Registration Deadline: November 4, 2016
